Name: Aboleth
Description: A large aberration, lawful evil, amphibious creature that can enslave minds and exude a mucous cloud.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tentacle
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 +5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become diseased.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 +5) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Enslave

SpecialAttacks.Name: Mucous Cloud
SpecialAttacks.Description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or hits it with a melee attack within 5 ft. must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become diseased.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Probing Telepathy
SpecialAttacks.Description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature’s greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

SpecialAttacks.Description: Costs 2 actions. Each creature within 15 ft. must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6+10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10+10) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

Name: Ancient Silver Dragon
Description: Ancient Silver Dragon is a gargantuan lawful good dragon. It boasts legendary resistance, a terrifying Frightful Presence, two breath weapons (Cold Breath and Paralyzing Breath), a devastating melee repertoire (Bite, Claw, Tail), and the ability to magically change shape.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10+10) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d6+10) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d8+10) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Cold Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: Cold Breath. The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 90‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Paralyzing Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: Paralyzing Breath. The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 90‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAttacks.Description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 ft. and aware of it must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Change Shape
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10+10) piercing damage.

Name: Ancient White Dragon
Description: A gargantuan, chaotic‑evil white dragon. It can glide across icy surfaces, exhale freezing breath, and strike with a powerful bite, claws and tail. Its frightful presence can terrorize foes within 120 ft.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10+8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8+8) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Cold Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 90‑ft. cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 72 (16d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10+8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

Name: Androsphinx
Description: A massive lion‑bodied sphinx with a humanoid head, known for its inscrutable nature and powerful magical roars. It possesses high intelligence, wisdom, and charisma, and is immune to psychic damage and several conditions.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10+6) slashing damage.

Description: Antimagic Susceptibility: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster’s spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute. False Appearance: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Slam
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam

Name: Ankheg
Description: A large, ant‑like monstrous creature that burrows underground and can spray acid at its foes.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Acid Spray
SpecialAttacks.Description: The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, provided that it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can bite only the grappled creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Fist
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Rock

DefaultAttack.Name: Fist
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Archmage
Description: The Archmage has Magic Resistance, giving it advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. It is an 18th‑level spellcaster (Intelligence 20, spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks) and can cast disguise self and invisibility at will. It prepares a wide variety of wizard spells from cantrips up to 9th‑level, including powerful options such as time stop, teleport, and globe of invulnerability. In combat it wields a dagger that can be used as a melee or ranged weapon.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Dagger
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Lightning Bolt
SpecialAttacks.Description: The Archmage summans a lightning in a 90‑foot line that is 5 ft. wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Dagger
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

Name: Assassin
Description: A deadly assassin (any non‑good alignment) that specializes in surprise attacks. It has advantage on its first turn and can deal critical hits to surprised foes. It can evade area effects and deliver sneak‑attack damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
SpecialAttacks.Description: The assassin deals an extra 13 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn’t incapacitated and the assassin doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Assassinate
SpecialAttacks.Description: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Evasion
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Awakened Shrub
Description: An awakened shrub is a small, plant‑based creature that can move and attack. While motionless it looks indistinguishable from a normal shrub, but it can strike with its rake‑like vines.

SpecialAttacks.Name: False Appearance
SpecialAttacks.Description: While the shrub remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal shrub.

DefaultAttack.Name: Rake
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) slashing damage.

Name: Awakened Tree
Description: An enormous, sentient tree that appears as a normal tree when motionless. While immobile it is indistinguishable from a regular tree (False Appearance). In combat it uses a powerful Slam attack that deals 3d6+4 bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

Name: Azer
Description: Azer is a lawful‑neutral elemental that fights with a warhammer. Its body radiates heat, causing fire damage to anyone who touches it. It can also illuminate its surroundings.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Warhammer (Bludgeoning)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Warhammer (Fire)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Extra fire damage added to the warhammer attack: 3 (1d6) fire damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Warhammer
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Name: Balor
Description: A massive, winged demon of chaotic evil alignment. This huge fiend wields a flaming longsword and a deadly whip, radiates a fire aura, and explodes on death.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Death Throes
SpecialAttacks.Description: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren’t being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor’s weapons.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Fire Aura
SpecialAttacks.Description: At the start of each of the balor’s turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren’t being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Resistance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The balor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

DefaultAttack.Name: Longsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the balor scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

Name: Bandit Captain
Description: A cunning leader of bandits, commanding others with brutal efficiency.

Name: Barbed Devil
Description: A Medium fiend of lawful evil alignment. The barbed devil has a natural armor class of 15 and 110 hit points. It is resistant to cold and non‑magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (unless silvered), immune to fire, poison, and the poisoned condition. It can see in magical darkness, has advantage on saving throws against spells, and damages any creature that grapples it with its barbed hide. It can make three melee attacks (two claws and a tail) or hurl flame twice as a ranged spell attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. Flammable objects not being worn or carried catch fire.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Name: Basilisk
Description: A medium‑sized monstrous reptile with a deadly petrifying gaze. Any creature that meets its gaze must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or begin turning to stone. The basilisk can also bite, dealing piercing and poison damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Petrifying Gaze
SpecialAttacks.Description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn’t incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn’t surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can’t see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 ft. of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

Name: Bat
Description: A tiny, unaligned beast. It cannot use its blindsight while deafened. It has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. It can bite for 1 piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Description: A black pudding is an ooze that can slip through spaces as thin as one inch and has a corrosive, dissolving body.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage.

Description: A young brass dragon that can unleash a line of fire or a cone of sleep gas. It attacks with a bite and uses breath weapons after a recharge roll.

SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales fire in a 20‑foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales sleep gas in a 15‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

Standing Leap: The bulette's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 15 ft., with or without a running start.

Bite: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d12+4) piercing damage.

Deadly Leap: If the bulette jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked prone and take 14 (3d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (3d6+4) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn’t knocked prone, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the bulette’s space into an unoccupied space of the creature’s choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the bulette’s space.

Description: The Chain Devil is a Medium fiend with a natural armor class of 16. It has 85 hit points, a walk speed of 30 feet, and is immune to fire and poison. It can see in magical darkness, resists spells, and possesses Devil's Sight and Magic Resistance. Its primary attack is a Chain that deals 2d6+4 slashing damage, can grapple the target (DC 14), and deals ongoing piercing damage. It can animate up to four chains to make additional attacks. The creature is hostile toward adventurers.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Chain
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if the devil isn’t already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 7 (2d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if the devil isn’t already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 7 (2d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

Name: Chimera
Description: A fearsome hybrid monster with a lion's body, a goat's head, and a dragon's head, capable of melee attacks and a fiery breath.

Name: Chuul
Description: Chuul is a large aberration of chaotic evil alignment. It has a natural armor class of 16, 93 hit points and can move 30 feet on land and 30 feet while swimming. Its ability scores are Strength 19, Dexterity 10, Constitution 16, Intelligence 5, Wisdom 11, Charisma 5. The creature is immune to poison and the poisoned condition, has darkvision 60 ft., and a passive perception of 14. It can breathe air and water (Amphibious) and senses magic within 120 ft. It attacks with a pincer strike that deals 2d6+4 bludgeoning damage and can grapple its target, and it can use tentacles to poison and paralyze a grappled creature.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Pincer
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the chuul doesn’t have two other creatures grappled.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tentacles
SpecialAttacks.Description: One creature grappled by the chuul must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

DefaultAttack.Name: Pincer
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the chuul doesn’t have two other creatures grappled.

Name: Clay Golem
Description: A large clay construct created to obey its creator. It is immune to many conditions and damage types, can absorb acid, and can go berserk when its health is low.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Acid Absorption
SpecialAttacks.Description: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Berserk
SpecialAttacks.Description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Immutable Form
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Resistance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Weapons
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Name: Cloaker
Description: The Cloaker is a large aberration that can attach to creatures, transferring damage. It can appear as a dark leather cloak, is light‑sensitive, can frighten nearby creatures with its moan, and creates illusory duplicates with its Phantasms ability.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target’s head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Moan
SpecialAttacks.Description: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn’t an aberration must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of the cloaker’s next turn. If a creature’s saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker’s moan for the next 24 hours.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Phantasms
SpecialAttacks.Description:
The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn’t in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.
Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can’t see or if it relies on senses other than sight.
A duplicate has the cloaker’s AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target’s head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

Name: Cloud Giant
Description:
Keen Smell: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Innate Spellcasting: The giant’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form.

DefaultAttack.Name: Morningstar
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

Name: Cockatrice
Description: A small, unaligned monstrosity that attacks with a poisonous bite that can petrify its victims.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or begin turning to stone and become restrained. The effect repeats at the end of its next turn, eventually petrifying the creature for 24 hours on a failed save.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or begin turning to stone and become restrained. The effect repeats at the end of its next turn, eventually petrifying the creature for 24 hours on a failed save.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Club
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Club
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Constrict
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Copper Dragon Wyrmling
Description: A young copper dragon, chaotic good in alignment. It can bite foes and unleash two types of breath weapons: an acidic line and a slowing cone.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Acid Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales acid in a 20‑foot line that is 5 ft wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Slowing Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales gas in a 15‑foot cone. Each creature must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or suffer multiple effects: no reactions, speed halved, and can make only one attack each turn. The effect lasts 1 minute and can be ended early with a successful saving throw at the end of each turn.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage.

Name: Couatl
Description: The couatl is a Medium celestial serpent known for its innate spellcasting, magical weapon attacks, and shielded mind. It can bite, constrict, and change shape into a humanoid or beast. It is lawful‑good and typically friendly toward adventurers.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d6+5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Constrict
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d6+5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

Name: Crab
Description: Amphibious: The crab can breathe air and water.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

Name: Crocodile
Description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes. It can bite, dealing 1d10+2 piercing damage and grappling the target.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

Name: Cult Fanatic
Description: A fanatical cultist who fights with a dagger and wields cleric spells. He has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened and can cast spells such as light, sacred flame, command, inflict wounds, shield of faith, hold person, and spiritual weapon. He makes two melee attacks per Multiattack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Dark Devotion
SpecialAttacks.Description: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Spellcasting
SpecialAttacks.Description: The fanatic is a 4th‑level spellcaster (Wisdom save DC 11, +3 to hit). Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy. 1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith. 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon.

DefaultAttack.Name: Dagger
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

Name: Cultist
Description: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. It attacks with a scimitar: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Scimitar
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Scimitar
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

Name: Darkmantle
Description: The darkmantle can’t use its blindsight while deafened. While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite. A 15‑foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Echolocation
SpecialAttacks.Description: The darkmantle can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

SpecialAttacks.Name: False Appearance
SpecialAttacks.Description: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Darkness Aura
SpecialAttacks.Description: A 15‑foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

DefaultAttack.Name: Crush
DefaultAttack.Description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target’s head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.
While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle’s speed also becomes 0, it can’t benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful DC 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin)
Description: A small deep gnome adept at hiding in stone, using its Stone Camouflage, Gnome Cunning, and innate spellcasting.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Poisoned Dart
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

DefaultAttack.Name: War Pick
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Deer
Description: A small woodland deer, known for its speed and keen senses.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

Name: Deva
Description: A celestial being of lawful good alignment. It wields a magical mace that deals bludgeoning and radiant damage, can cast innate spells such as detect evil and good, and possesses Angelic Weapons, Magic Resistance and Healing Touch.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Angelic Weapons
SpecialAttacks.Description: The deva’s weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Healing Touch
SpecialAttacks.Description: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness. Usable 3 times per day.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Change Shape
SpecialAttacks.Description: The deva can polymorph into a humanoid or beast with a CR equal to or less than its own, retaining its stats but swapping AC, movement, Str, Dex, and special senses for those of the new form.

DefaultAttack.Name: Mace
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

Name: Djinni
Description: A large elemental of chaotic good alignment. The djinni can make three scimitar attacks, cast a variety of spells innately, and can create a swirling whirlwind. If it dies, its body turns to a warm breeze, leaving only its equipment behind.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Scimitar
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni’s choice).

DefaultAttack.Name: Scimitar
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni’s choice).

Name: Doppelganger
Description: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. In the first round of combat, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised. If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack. It can also magically read the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 ft.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Surprise Attack
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Read Thoughts
SpecialAttacks.Description: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 ft. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 ft of wood or dirt, 2 ft of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger’s concentration isn’t broken. While reading the target’s mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Draft Horse
Description: A large beast of burden, the draft horse is strong and capable of pulling heavy wagons. It is typically unaligned and acts according to its trainer's commands.

DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Dragon Turtle
Description: A gargantuan dragon‑type creature that is neutral in alignment. It has a natural armor class of 20, 341 hit points, and moves 20 ft. on land and 40 ft. while swimming. It is strong (Strength 25), sturdy (Constitution 20), and possesses amphibious breathing. It can make a multi‑attack with its bite, claws, tail, and a steam breath that deals fire damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Steam Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn’t grant resistance against this damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

Name: Dretch
Description: A small chaotic evil fiend that attacks with a bite, claws, and a foul gas cloud.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Multiattack
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dretch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Fetid Cloud
SpecialAttacks.Description: A 10‑foot radius of disgusting green gas that poisons creatures that start their turn in it (DC 11 CON save).

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

Name: Drider
Description: The drider has several innate abilities: Fey Ancestry (advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep), Innate Spellcasting (Wisdom spell save DC 13, at will dancing lights, 1/day darkness, faerie fire), Spider Climb (can climb difficult surfaces, including upside‑down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check), Sunlight Sensitivity (disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight while in sunlight), Web Walker (ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

Name: Drow
Description: Fey Ancestry: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep. Innate Spellcasting: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: dancing lights; 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire. Sunlight Sensitivity: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Hand Crossbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Druid
Description:
The druid is a 4th‑level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh
- 1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave
- 2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin

Actions:
Quarterstaff – Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

DefaultAttack.Name: Quarterstaff
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

Name: Dryad
Description: No description provided.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Club
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1 d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

DefaultAttack.Name: Club
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1 d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

Name: Duergar
Description: Duergar are subterranean dwarf‑like humanoids known for their resilience, sun‑light sensitivity, and ability to enlarge or become invisible.

DefaultAttack.Name: War Pick
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8+2) piercing damage while enlarged.

Name: Dust Mephit
Description: A small elemental creature made of swirling dust. It attacks with clawed melee strikes and a blinding dust breath that can temporarily blind foes.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Blinding Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The mephit exhales a 15‑foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

Name: Eagle
Description: A small bird of prey with keen sight. The eagle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. It attacks with its talons.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Talons
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Talons
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

Name: Earth Elemental
Description: An Earth Elemental is a large, neutral-aligned elemental creature made of compact stone and earth. It can burrow through unworked earth and stone, and deals double damage to objects and structures. It attacks with powerful slam strikes.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Efreeti
Description: The efreeti is a large lawful‑evil elemental that dwells in the Elemental Plane of Fire. It can cast a variety of spells, wields a scimitar, and can hurl flames at foes. If it dies, its body disintegrates in a flash of fire, leaving only its equipment behind.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Scimitar
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Hurl Flame
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (5d6) fire damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Scimitar
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Name: Elephant
Description: If the elephant moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Stomp
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10+6) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Gore

SpecialAttacks.Name: Multiattack

A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack within 5 ft. takes 1d10 fire damage. It can also enter a hostile creature’s space, dealing 1d10 fire damage and igniting the creature.

Name: Gelatinous Cube
Description: A large, transparent ooze that fills its space and can engulf creatures. It has acidic attacks and several special abilities that allow it to hide, pull creatures out, and restrain engulfed targets.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Engulf
SpecialAttacks.Description:
The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures’ spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.
On a failed save, the cube enters the creature’s space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can’t breathe, is restrained, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the cube’s turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 12 Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Ooze Cube
SpecialAttacks.Description:
The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube’s Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.
A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Transparent
SpecialAttacks.Description: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube’s space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage. The ooze can eat through 2‑inch‑thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.
False Appearance: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

DefaultAttack.Name: Pseudopod
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Name: Green Dragon Wyrmling
Description: A young green dragon capable of breathing both air and water, wielding a poisonous bite and a poison breath attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Poison Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

Name: Green Hag
Description: A cunning Medium‑sized fey creature. The Green Hag is amphibious,can cast a few innate spells (dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery), mimics animal sounds and humanoid voices, and can disguise herself with an illusory appearance. In combat she attacks with her sharp claws and can become invisible to slip away.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage.

Name: Grick
Description: A medium-sized monstrosity that resembles a worm with a beak and tentacles. It has stone camouflage ability and can make tentacle and beak attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Beak
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Tentacles
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) slashing damage.

Name: Griffon
Description: A large, fearsome beast with the body of a lion, the head of an eagle, and powerful wings. It is unaligned and typically hostile toward adventurers.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

Name: Grimlock
Description: Grimlock is a blind, subterranean humanoid known for its keen hearing and smell, stone camouflage, and a spiked bone club attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Spiked Bone Club (Bludgeoning)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Spiked Bone Club (Piercing)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Spiked Bone Club
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Spear
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Name: Gynosphinx
Description: Inscrutable: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage. Magic Weapons: The sphinx’s weapon attacks are magical. Spellcasting: The sphinx is a 9th‑level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following wizard spells prepared: • Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, locate object, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, remove curse, tongues • 4th level (3 slots): banishment, greater invisibility • 5th level (1 slot): legend lore. Multiattack: The sphinx makes two claw attacks. Claw: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

Name: Hawk
Description: A tiny hawk.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Talons
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Talons
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

Name: Hell Hound
Description: A demonic hound that breathes fire. It has keen hearing and smell, and uses pack tactics.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Name: Hezrou
Description: A large fiend with a natural armor class of 16 and 136 hit points. It has Magic Resistance (advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects) and a poisonous Stench that forces nearby creatures to save DC 14 or become poisoned. It can Multiattack (one Bite and two Claws) and deals piercing and slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Resistance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The hezrou has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Stench
SpecialAttacks.Description: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 ft. of the hezrou must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the hezrou’s stench for 24 hours.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10+4) piercing damage.

Name: Hill Giant
Description: A massive, hulking giant of chaotic evil alignment. Hill Giants are known for their brute strength and love of smashing anything that stands in their way.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Greatclub
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Rock
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10+5) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greatclub
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Hippogriff
Description: A large, noble beast with the head of an eagle and the body of a horse. It is a monstrosity capable of flight and swift melee attacks.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Longsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Name: Homunculus
Description: Telepathic Bond: While the homunculus is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

Name: Horned Devil
Description: The Horned Devil is a large fiend (lawful evil) with a natural armor class of 18 and 178 hit points. It possesses Devil's Sight (magical darkness doesn’t impede its darkvision) and Magic Resistance (advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects). It can use a Multiattack (two Fork attacks and one Tail attack, or replace any with Hurl Flame). Its Fork is a melee weapon attack (+10 to hit, 10‑ft. reach) that deals 2d8+6 piercing damage. Its Tail is a melee weapon attack (+10 to hit, 10‑ft. reach) that deals 1d8+6 piercing damage and can inflict an infernal wound. Its Hurl Flame is a ranged spell attack (+7 to hit, 150‑ft. range) that deals 4d6 fire damage. The creature is immune to fire and poison, resistant to cold, and vulnerable to no damage types. It is hostile toward adventurers.

DefaultAttack.Name: Fork
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage.

Name: Hunter Shark
Description: A large beast shark. It has Blood Frenzy, granting advantage on melee attacks against creatures that are not at full health, and can only breathe underwater.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) piercing damage.

Name: Hydra
Description: The Hydra is a massive, multi‑headed monstrosity. It can hold its breath for an hour, has five heads granting it advantage on many saving throws, regrows heads when they are severed (unless it has taken fire damage), and each extra head grants an additional reaction for opportunity attacks. While it sleeps, at least one head remains awake.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) piercing damage.

Name: Hyena
Description: Hyena, a medium beast. Pack Tactics: advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hyena’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated. Bite: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

Name: Ice Devil
Description: Ice Devil is a large fiend with Devil's Sight and Magic Resistance. It can multi‑attack with a bite, claws, and tail, and can cast the spell Wall of Ice.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4+5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Wall of Ice
SpecialAttacks.Description: The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter. Creatures in its space must make a DC 17 Dexterity save, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half on a success. Each 10‑foot section of the wall has AC 5, 30 HP, vulnerability to fire, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. Destroyed sections leave frigid air that forces creatures moving through it to make a DC 17 Constitution save, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failure.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

Name: Ice Mephit
Description: Ice Mephit is a small elemental creature with a frosty appearance. It can attack with claws, exhale a cone of frost, and explode in a death burst when slain. It also possesses a false appearance ability and can innately cast fog cloud.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws (Slashing)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws (Cold)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) cold damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Frost Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The mephit exhales a 15‑foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Death Burst
SpecialAttacks.Description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 ft. must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws (Slashing)
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) slashing damage.

Name: Imp
Description: A tiny fiend that can polymorph into a rat, raven, or spider, turn invisible at will, and possesses magical resistance. It attacks with a sting that deals piercing and poison damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Sting (Bite in Beast Form)
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Iron Golem
Description: Iron Golem is a massive Large construct that is immune to fire, poison, psychic damage, and non‑magical weapons. It can absorb fire to heal itself, has an immutable form, magical weapon attacks, and advantage on saving throws against spells. It can make a multi‑attack with slam and sword attacks and exhale a poisonous cone.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Sword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10+7) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Poison Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8+7) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Jackal
Description: A small, unaligned beast that relies on keen hearing and smell. It uses pack tactics to gain advantage on attacks when allies are nearby.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

Name: Killer Whale
Description: A massive, intelligent predator of the seas. It can locate prey with its echolocation and hold its breath for long periods.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Name: Knight
Description: The Knight is a Medium‑sized humanoid that can be of any alignment. It wears armor with an AC of 18, has 52 hit points and can move 30 ft. per turn. Its notable abilities include Brave (advantage on saves against being frightened) and Leadership (allows allies to add a d4 to attack or save rolls).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Greatsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heavy Crossbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Leadership
SpecialAttacks.Description: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greatsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Name: Kobold
Description: A small, reptilian humanoid known for its cunning and pack tactics. It prefers to attack from the shadows and has sunlight sensitivity.

DefaultAttack.Name: Dagger
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Kraken
Description: A gargantuan sea monstrosity that dwells in the deepest ocean trenches. The kraken can breathe air and water, move swiftly through the water, and unleash devastating tentacle attacks, a crushing bite, lightning storms, and a powerful fling ability. It is immune to lightning and non‑magical weapon damage, and it cannot be frightened or paralyzed.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d8+10) piercing damage. The target can be swallowed if it is Large or smaller.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tentacle
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d6+10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Lightning Storm
SpecialAttacks.Description: The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 ft. The target must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d8+10) piercing damage. The target can be swallowed if it is Large or smaller.

Name: Lamia
Description: A Large, chaotic‑evil monstrosity with a serpentine lower body and a humanoid upper body. It possesses innate spellcasting and can strike with claws, a dagger, or an intoxicating magical touch.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Dagger
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Intoxicating Touch
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and all ability checks.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

Name: Lemure
Description: The lemure is a Medium fiend with darkvision 120 ft. It is immune to fire and poison, resistant to cold, and cannot be charmed, frightened, or poisoned. Special abilities: Devil's Sight – magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision; Hellish Rejuvenation – if it dies in the Nine Hells it returns to life with full hit points in 1d10 days unless killed by a good‑aligned creature with a bless spell or its remains are sprinkled with holy water. Action: Fist – melee weapon attack (+3) reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Fist
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Lich
Description: A powerful undead spellcaster that commands necromantic magic. It possesses legendary resistance, the ability to rejuvenate from a phylactery, and a suite of prepared wizard spells ranging from cantrips to 9th‑level evocations. Its signature attack, Paralyzing Touch, deals cold damage and can paralyze a creature for a minute. The lich is immune to many conditions and resistances, and it can use legendary actions such as a frightful gaze and a necrotic life‑draining burst.

DefaultAttack.Name: Paralyzing Touch
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Name: Lion
Description: Lion – a Large beast with keen smell, pack tactics and a powerful pounce. It can bite and claw foes, dealing piercing and slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage.
