DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Priest
Description: Divine Eminence: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage, increasing by 1d6 per spell slot level above 1st. Spellcasting: 5th‑level cleric (Wisdom) with spell save DC 13 and +5 to hit. Prepared spells include cantrips (light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy), 1st‑level (cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary), 2nd‑level (lesser restoration, spiritual weapon), and 3rd‑level (dispel magic, spirit guardians). Default attack: Mace – Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Mace
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

Name: Pseudodragon
Description: A tiny dragon with keen senses, magic resistance, and limited telepathy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Sting
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Quasit
Description: A tiny fiend that can shapeshift into a bat, centipede, or toad. It has magic resistance, can frighten foes with a scare, and can become invisible. Its natural weapons are claw attacks that deal piercing damage and can also poison the target.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw (Bite in Beast Form)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Scare
SpecialAttacks.Description: One creature of the quasit’s choice within 20 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the quasit is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Invisibility
SpecialAttacks.Description: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw (Bite in Beast Form)
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Name: Rakshasa
Description: Rakshasa is a Medium fiend, lawful evil. It has Limited Magic Immunity (cannot be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be, and has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects) and Innate Spellcasting (Charisma, spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks; at will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion; 3/day each: charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion; 1/day each: dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing). It can use a Multiattack to make two claw attacks. Claw: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed, preventing any benefit from short or long rests until the curse is lifted.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Name: Raven
Description: A Tiny beast, unaligned. It can mimic simple sounds it has heard (Mimicry). It attacks with its beak, a melee weapon that deals 1 piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Beak
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Name: Red Dragon Wyrmling
Description: Red Dragon Wyrmling, a chaotic‑evil medium dragon. It can bite and unleash a cone of fire.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10+4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Name: Reef Shark
Description: Reef Shark is a Medium beast. It has Pack Tactics: The shark has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated. Water Breathing: The shark can breathe only underwater. It can make a Bite attack: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

Name: Remorhaz
Description: A massive, heat‑radiating monstrosity that dwells in icy caverns. Its body burns hot enough to scorch anything that touches it. It can bite, grapple, swallow, and its heated body deals fire damage to creatures that come within 5 feet.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heated Body
SpecialAttacks.Description: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 40 (6d10+7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can’t bite another target.

Name: Rhinoceros
Description: A massive large beast resembling a rhinoceros, known for its powerful charge and gore attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Charge
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the rhinoceros moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

DefaultAttack.Name: Gore
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Riding Horse
Description: No description provided.

DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Roc
Description: A gargantuan monstrous bird of prey. The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and can make a powerful beak attack and crushing talons that grapple its target.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Beak
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8+9) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Talons
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6+9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8+9) piercing damage.

Name: Roper
Description: The roper is a large monstrosity that resembles a stalagmite and can grapple with its tendrils. It can hide among cave formations (False Appearance), extend up to six tendrils that grapple and restrain victims (Grasping Tendrils), and climb any surface upside‑down (Spider Climb).

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8+4) piercing damage.

Name: Rug of Smothering
Description: A Large construct that looks like an ordinary rug when motionless. It can grapple a creature, restrain, blind and suffocate it while dealing bludgeoning damage each turn. It also transfers half of any damage it receives to the grappled creature and is immune to poison and psychic damage. The rug is incapacitated in an antimagic field and can be knocked unconscious by a failed Constitution save against dispel magic.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Antimagic Susceptibility
SpecialAttacks.Description: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster’s spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Damage Transfer
SpecialAttacks.Description: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

SpecialAttacks.Name: False Appearance
SpecialAttacks.Description: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

DefaultAttack.Name: Smother
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can’t smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target’s turns, the target takes 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Rust Monster
Description: A medium‑sized monstrosity that feeds on ferrous metal. It can smell metal within 30 ft, corrode weapons and armor with its bite, and can target metal objects with its antennae.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Iron Scent
SpecialAttacks.Description: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Rust Metal
SpecialAttacks.Description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Antennae
SpecialAttacks.Description: The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 ft. If the object isn’t being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1‑foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster’s touch. Metal armor or shields take a permanent –1 AC penalty; a held metal weapon rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8+1) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

Name: Sahuagin
Description: A cruel, fish‑like humanoid that hunts on coasts and in the sea. It has Blood Frenzy (advantage on melee attacks against creatures that aren’t at full health), Limited Amphibiousness (can breathe air and water but must be submerged every 4 hours), and Shark Telepathy (can command any shark within 120 ft). It can make a multi‑attack using its bite, claws, or spear.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

Name: Salamander
Description: A Large elemental salamander that is neutral evil. It has a natural armor class of 15, 90 hit points, and walks 30 feet per turn. It deals fire damage on contact (Heated Body) and its weapons are flaming (Heated Weapons). It can make a multi‑attack using a spear and a tail. The spear is a melee or ranged weapon that deals 2d6+4 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage. The tail is a melee weapon that deals 2d6+4 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 fire damage and can grapple the target.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heated Body
SpecialAttacks.Description: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heated Weapons
SpecialAttacks.Description: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

DefaultAttack.Name: Spear
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8+4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 1d6 fire damage.

Name: Satyr
Description: A chaotic‑neutral fey creature that enjoys music and revelry. It has magic resistance, giving it advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Ram
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4+1) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortbow
DefaultAttack.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Sting
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Scout
Description: A scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight. It can make two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Multiattack
SpecialAttacks.Description: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

Name: Sea Hag
Description: Sea Hag (CR 2, Fey) – Medium size, chaotic evil. AC 14 (natural). HP 52 (7d8 + 21). Speed 30 ft., swim 40 ft. Ability scores: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 16, Int 12, Wis 12, Cha 13. Special abilities: Amphibious (breathes air and water), Horrific Appearance (frightens nearby creatures). Actions include a melee Claw attack (2d6 + 3 slashing), a terrifying Death Glare that can drop a frightened target to 0 HP on a failed DC 11 Wis save, and Illusory Appearance (magical disguise). Hostile.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Death Glare
SpecialAttacks.Description: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 ft. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or drop to 0 hit points.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Illusory Appearance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The hag covers herself and everything she carries with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her size and humanoid shape.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Name: Sea Horse
Description: A tiny sea horse, capable of breathing only underwater.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: The sea horse has no offensive capability.

Name: Shadow
Description: The Shadow is a Medium undead that can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing (Amorphous). While in dim light or darkness it can hide as a bonus action with a +6 Stealth bonus (Shadow Stealth). Sunlight gives it disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws (Sunlight Weakness). It attacks with Strength Drain, a melee weapon attack that deals 2d6+2 necrotic damage and can reduce a target's Strength score.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Strength Drain
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) necrotic damage, and the target’s Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non‑evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

DefaultAttack.Name: Strength Drain
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) necrotic damage, and the target’s Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non‑evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

Name: Shambling Mound
Description: A Large plant creature that can engulf opponents and absorb lightning. It makes two slam attacks and can use an engulf attack. It is hostile and has special lightning absorption.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Slam
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Engulf
SpecialAttacks.Description: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound’s turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Shield Guardian
Description: A Large, unaligned construct bound to an amulet. It has a natural armor class of 17, 142 hit points, and can regenerate 10 HP each turn. Its special abilities include Bound (damage transfer), Regeneration, and Spell Storing. It can make two melee fist attacks each round.

DefaultAttack.Name: Fist
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Shrieker
Description: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

DefaultAttack.Name: None
DefaultAttack.Description: No attack

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

Name: Skeleton
Description: An undead skeleton that serves as a low‑level combatant. It is armed with a shortsword and a shortbow.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Name: Solar
Description: A mighty celestial entity of lawful good alignment. It fights with a radiant greatsword and a deadly longbow, can summon a hovering sword, heal allies, teleport, and unleash searing bursts of fire and radiant energy. Its presence radiates divine power.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Slaying Longbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target has 190 HP or fewer, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Flying Sword
SpecialAttacks.Description: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically within 5 ft. It can command the sword as a bonus action to fly up to 50 ft. and make one attack or return to its hands. The sword is considered held by the solar.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Healing Touch
SpecialAttacks.Description: The solar touches another creature. The target regains 40 (8d8+4) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness. Usable 4 times per day.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greatsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6+8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

Name: Specter
Description: A incorporeal undead that can drain life. It is immune to many damage types and conditions, and can move through objects.

DefaultAttack.Name: Life Drain
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Name: Spirit Naga
Description:
Rejuvenation: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

Spellcasting: The naga is a 10th‑level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:
- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost
- 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep
- 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person
- 3rd level (3 slots): lightning bolt, water breathing
- 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
- 5th level (2 slots): dominate person

Action – Bite: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heart Sight
SpecialAttacks.Description: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature’s current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 10 Charisma saving throw, the sprite also knows the creature’s alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Invisibility
SpecialAttacks.Description: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

DefaultAttack.Name: Longsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

Name: Spy
Description: A cunning infiltrator skilled in deception, insight, investigation, perception, persuasion, and stealth. It can use Cunning Action and perform Sneak Attack.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

Name: Steam Mephit
Description: A small elemental creature that exhales scorching steam and can bite with fiery claws.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws (Slashing)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d4 slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws (Fire)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d4 fire damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Steam Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The mephit exhales a 15‑foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claws (Slashing)
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d4 slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Blood Drain
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn’t attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge’s turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss. The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

Name: Stone Giant
Description: Stone Giant is a massive giant that fights with a greatclub and thrown rocks. It has Stone Camouflage, giving advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in rocky terrain. It can make two greatclub attacks per Multiattack and a rock ranged attack.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greatclub
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Stone Golem
Description: A massive stone construct, standing large and unaligned. It has an AC of 17, 178 hit points, and a walking speed of 30 ft. It is immune to poison, psychic, and non‑magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and cannot be charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, or suffer exhaustion. Its special abilities include Immutable Form, Magic Resistance, Magic Weapons, and the Slow spell‑like effect. It attacks with powerful slam strikes.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Immutable Form
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Resistance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Weapons
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Slow
SpecialAttacks.Description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 ft. of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target can’t use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can’t make more than one attack on its turn. These effects last for 1 minute, with a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Storm Giant
Description: Storm giants are massive, weather‑weaving giants. They are chaotic good in alignment, can breathe air and water, and possess innate spellcasting that lets them control weather, detect magic, and more. They wield a greatsword, hurl rocks, and unleash a devastating lightning strike.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Greatsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Rock
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Lightning Strike
SpecialAttacks.Description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greatsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

Name: Succubus/Incubus
Description: A fiendish shape‑changer that can assume a Small or Medium humanoid form. It is a charismatic manipulator that uses telepathy, charm, draining kisses, claws and etherealness to terrorize its foes.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Charm
SpecialAttacks.Description: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend’s verbal or telepathic commands. The effect ends if the target is harmed or receives a suicidal command, or after a successful saving throw. The target is immune to this charm for 24 hours after it ends.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Draining Kiss
SpecialAttacks.Description: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 32 (5d10+5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The target’s hit‑point maximum is reduced by the damage taken until it finishes a long rest. The target dies if its maximum is reduced to 0.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Etherealness
SpecialAttacks.Description: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

DefaultAttack.Name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

Name: Swarm of Bats
Description: A swarm of Tiny beasts that fly together, relying on echolocation and keen hearing. The swarm can occupy other creatures' spaces and cannot regain hit points.

WeaponProperties: advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing
SpecialAttacks.Name: Bites
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 5 (2d4) piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 5 (2d4) piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Beetles
Description: A mass of tiny beetles that acts as a hostile swarm. It can occupy another creature's space, move through openings large enough for a Tiny insect, and cannot regain or gain temporary hit points.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Insects
Description: A mass of tiny insects that moves as a single entity. The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. It cannot regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. It attacks with a swarm of bites that deal piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Swarm
SpecialAttacks.Description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Poisonous Snakes
Description: A mass of tiny poisonous snakes that acts as a single creature. The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through openings large enough for a Tiny snake. It cannot regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. Its primary attack is a bite that deals piercing and poison damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Swarm
SpecialAttacks.Description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Swarm of Quippers
Description: A hostile swarm of tiny fish that attacks with bites. Special abilities: Blood Frenzy (advantage on melee attacks against wounded creatures), Swarm (occupy the same space as a creature and cannot regain hit points), Water Breathing (breathes only underwater).

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Rats
Description: A mass of tiny rats that moves as a single entity. The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell (Keen Smell). It can occupy another creature’s space and move through openings large enough for a Tiny rat. It cannot regain hit points or gain temporary hit points (Swarm). Its primary attack is a bite that deals 2d6 piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Swarm
SpecialAttacks.Description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Keen Smell
SpecialAttacks.Description: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Ravens
Description: Swarm: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.\n\nBeaks: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beaks
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Swarm of Spiders
Description: A swarm of tiny spiders that act as a single entity, capable of climbing walls, sensing webs, and delivering a painful bite.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bites
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Name: Tarrasque
Description: The tarrasque is a gargantuan, nearly indestructible monstrosity. It possesses legendary resistance, magic resistance, a reflective carapace, and a siege monster trait that lets it devastate structures. Its presence is frightful, and it can swallow creatures whole.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Horns
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

Name: Thug
Description: A medium humanoid thug. It has the Pack Tactics ability. It can make a melee Mace attack and a ranged Heavy Crossbow attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Pack Tactics
SpecialAttacks.Description: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Mace
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heavy Crossbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Mace
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Tiger
Description: A fierce large beast, adept at ambush and powerful melee attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

Name: Treant
Description: A massive, sentient tree that can attack with powerful slam and rock strikes, animate other trees, and blend perfectly into a forest with its false appearance. It deals double damage to objects and structures.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Tribal Warrior
Description: A tribal warrior is a humanoid combatant that fights using pack tactics and a versatile spear.

DefaultAttack.Name: Spear
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands.

Name: Triceratops
Description: A massive herbivorous beast. It can perform a Trampling Charge that can knock foes prone and follow up with a Stomp attack.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Trampling Charge
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the triceratops moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

DefaultAttack.Name: Gore
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8+6) piercing damage.

Name: Troll
Description: Keen Smell: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Regeneration: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the troll’s next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
Description: A massive predatory dinosaur, the tyrannosaurus rex is a huge beast that hunts with powerful bite and tail attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tail
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8+7) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (4d12+7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

Name: Unicorn
Description: A celestial unicorn, lawful good and radiant. It possesses a charge, innate spellcasting, magic resistance, and magic weapons.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Charge
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the unicorn moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Innate Spellcasting
SpecialAttacks.Description:
The unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace
1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Resistance
SpecialAttacks.Description: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Magic Weapons
SpecialAttacks.Description: The unicorn’s weapon attacks are magical.

DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Vampire, Vampire Form
Description: The vampire can shape‑change into a bat or a mist cloud when not in sunlight or running water. It has legendary resistance, misty escape, regeneration, spider climb and several vampiric weaknesses (forbiddance, running water, stake to the heart, sunlight hypersensitivity). It can make a multi‑attack (two attacks, only one bite), an unarmed strike, a bite that deals piercing and necrotic damage and heals the vampire, a charm spell (DC 17 Wisdom) and summon swarms of bats, rats or wolves (Children of the Night). It also has three legendary actions (Move, Unarmed Strike, Bite).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Unarmed Strike
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 18).

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled, incapacitated or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit‑point maximum is reduced by the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains that many hit points. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the reduction brings the maximum to 0 the target dies. A humanoid slain this way rises as a vampire spawn under the vampire’s control.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Charm
SpecialAttacks.Description: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed. The charmed creature treats the vampire as a trusted friend, takes the vampire’s requests favorably and is a willing target for the vampire’s bite. The effect ends if the creature succeeds on a subsequent saving throw, after 24 hours, if the vampire is destroyed, if the creature is on a different plane, or if the vampire uses a bonus action to end it.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Children of the Night
SpecialAttacks.Description: The vampire magically summons 2d4 swarms of bats or rats (or 3d6 wolves if outdoors) when the sun isn’t up. The summoned creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, act as allies for up to 1 hour, obey spoken commands, and can be dismissed as a bonus action.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled, incapacitated or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit‑point maximum is reduced by the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains that many hit points.

Name: Vampire, Bat Form
Description:
The vampire can shapeshift when not in sunlight or running water, turning into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist and back to its true form. While in bat form it cannot speak, walks at 5 ft., flies at 30 ft., and its statistics remain unchanged except size and speed. While in mist form it cannot act, speak, or manipulate objects, is weightless, flies at 20 ft., can hover, and can move through spaces as air. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saves and is immune to non‑magical damage except sunlight.

Legendary Resistance: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Misty Escape: When reduced to 0 HP outside its resting place (and not in sunlight or running water) it transforms into mist instead of falling unconscious. If it cannot transform it is destroyed. While in mist with 0 HP it cannot revert until it reaches its resting place within 2 hours, after which it becomes paralyzed until it regains at least 1 HP. After an hour at its resting place with 0 HP it regains 1 HP.

Regeneration: The vampire regains 20 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn’t in sunlight or running water. Radiant damage or holy water prevents this regeneration for the next turn.

Spider Climb: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside‑down on ceilings, without needing an ability check.

Vampire Weaknesses: The vampire cannot enter a residence without invitation, takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water, can be staked in the heart while incapacitated in its resting place (paralyzing it until the stake is removed), and takes 20 radiant damage at the start of its turn in sunlight (and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while in sunlight).

Actions: Bite – Melee Weapon Attack (+9) with 1d6+4 piercing damage plus 3d6 necrotic damage; the target’s hit‑point maximum is reduced by the necrotic damage and the vampire regains that amount. Charm – Targets one humanoid within 30 ft.; DC 17 Wisdom save or be charmed. Children of the Night – Calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats (or 3d6 wolves outdoors) as a bonus action, once per day.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire’s control.

Name: Vampire, Mist Form
Description: A mist‑form vampire that can shapeshift into a bat or a cloud of mist. It possesses legendary resistance, regeneration, spider climb, and several weaknesses such as sunlight hypersensitivity and vulnerability to running water.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: The vampire makes one bite attack.

Name: Vampire Spawn
Description: The vampire spawn is a lesser undead that retains many of the powers of a vampire. It can regenerate, climb walls, and possesses several weaknesses such as aversion to sunlight, running water, and a wooden stake to the heart. In combat it can use a multiattack consisting of a bite that drains life and claw attacks that can grapple.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 1d6+3 piercing damage plus 2d6 necrotic damage; the target's hit point maximum is reduced by the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains that amount of HP.

Name: Veteran
Description: Medium humanoid, any alignment. A seasoned combatant proficient with longsword, shortsword and heavy crossbow.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10+3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Heavy Crossbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10+1) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Longsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10+3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Name: Violet Fungus
Description: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus. It can make Rotting Touch attacks that deal necrotic damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Rotting Touch
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Rotting Touch
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

Name: Vrock
Description: A large fiend with magical resistance that can make a beak attack and talons attack, and can unleash poisonous spores and a stunning screech.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) piercing damage.

Name: Vulture
Description: A small carrion bird with keen sight and a propensity for working in packs. It can use its beak to make a melee attack dealing 1d4 piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Keen Sight and Smell
SpecialAttacks.Description: The vulture has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Pack Tactics
SpecialAttacks.Description: The vulture has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

DefaultAttack.Name: Beak
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

Name: Warhorse
Description: A large, strong horse trained for battle.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Trampling Charge
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the horse moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Hooves
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Water Elemental
Description: A Large elemental of water. It can slip into a hostile creature’s space and move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing (Water Form). If it takes cold damage it partially freezes, reducing its speed by 20 ft. (Freeze). It can make two slam attacks per turn (Multiattack). Its primary melee attack is a Slam that deals 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage. It also has the Whelm ability, which forces a creature in its space to make a DC 15 Strength save or take 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage and become grappled and restrained.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Water Form
SpecialAttacks.Description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Freeze
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 ft. until the end of its next turn.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Whelm
SpecialAttacks.Description: Each creature in the elemental’s space must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage and is grappled (escape DC 14). The grappled target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. On a success, the target is pushed out of the elemental’s space. The elemental can grapple one Large or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at a time. At the start of each of the elemental’s turns, each grappled target takes 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Slam
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Name: Weasel
Description: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. It can make a Bite attack: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Name: Werebear, Bear Form
Description: A fearsome lycanthrope that can shift between bear‑humanoid forms. It has the Shapechanger ability, granting it the power to polymorph, and Keen Smell, giving advantage on perception checks that rely on smell. In combat it uses a powerful Bite attack and vicious Claw attacks.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10+4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

Name: Werebear, Human Form
Description: A humanoid werebear that can use its Shapechanger ability to polymorph into a Large bear‑humanoid hybrid or a Large bear. It has Keen Smell, granting advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. In bear form it makes two claw attacks; in humanoid form it makes two greataxe attacks; in hybrid form it can attack as either.

DefaultAttack.Name: Greataxe
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

Name: Werebear, Hybrid Form
Description: The werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear‑humanoid hybrid or into a Large bear, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. The werebear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claw
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Greataxe
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

Name: Wereboar, Boar Form
Description: The wereboar can use its action to polymorph into a boar‑humanoid hybrid or into a boar, or back into its true humanoid form. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. It has a special Charge ability (usable only in Boar or Hybrid form) that adds extra slashing damage and can knock a target prone, and a Relentless trait that prevents it from being reduced to 0 HP if the damage taken is 14 or less. Its signature attack is a pair of tusks that deliver slashing damage and can infect a humanoid with lycanthropy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Tusks
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
SpecialAttacks.Description: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

DefaultAttack.Name: Tusks
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

Name: Wererat, Human Form
Description: The wererat can use its action to polymorph into a rat‑humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. The wererat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. It can make two attacks per round, only one of which can be a bite. Its melee attack is a Shortsword (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing damage). Its ranged attack is a Hand Crossbow (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing damage).

DefaultAttack.Name: Shortsword
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

Name: Wererat, Hybrid Form
Description: The wererat can polymorph into a rat‑humanoid hybrid or a giant rat, and back to its true humanoid form (Shapechanger). It has keen smell granting advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. In combat it uses a Multiattack (two attacks, only one can be a bite) and can bite, slash with a shortsword, or fire a hand crossbow.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Shortsword
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Hand Crossbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

Name: Weretiger, Human Form
Description: The weretiger can shapechange into a tiger‑humanoid hybrid or a full tiger. It has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. In humanoid form it can make two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks; in hybrid form it can attack like a humanoid or make two claw attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Scimitar
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Longbow
SpecialAttacks.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Scimitar
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Name: Weretiger, Hybrid Form
Description: Weretiger, Hybrid Form is a Medium humanoid that can shape‑change into a tiger or a tiger‑humanoid hybrid. It possesses keen hearing and smell, granting advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on those senses. Its Pounce ability lets it knock a creature prone after moving 15 ft. and striking with a claw, then follow up with a bite as a bonus action. It can use a Multiattack to strike with scimitars, a longbow, claws, or a bite. The creature is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non‑magical weapons that aren’t silvered.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.

Name: Werewolf, Human Form
Description: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf‑humanoid hybrid or a wolf, or back into its true humanoid form. Its statistics, other than AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. It can make a Multiattack (two spears in humanoid form or one bite and one claw in hybrid form). Its melee or ranged spear attack deals 1d6+2 piercing damage (or 1d8+2 when used with two hands).

DefaultAttack.Name: Spear
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Name: Werewolf, Hybrid Form
Description: A chaotic‑evil Medium Humanoid werewolf in its hybrid form. It can shape‑change, has keen hearing and smell, and fights with a poisonous bite that can transmit lycanthropy and with slashing claws.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Bite
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Claws
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d4+2) slashing damage.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

Name: Werewolf, Wolf Form
Description: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.\nThe werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.\nBite: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

Name: White Dragon Wyrmling
Description: A chaotic evil medium dragon known as a White Dragon Wyrmling. It has a natural armor class of 16, 32 hit points, and a chilling breath weapon.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Cold Breath
SpecialAttacks.Description: The dragon exhales an icy blast of hail in a 15‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

Name: Will-o'-Wisp
Description: A malevolent, floating undead spirit that lures travelers with its eerie light and attacks with lightning. It can consume the life of dying creatures, become invisible, and move through objects.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Consume Life
SpecialAttacks.Description: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 ft. of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Ephemeral
SpecialAttacks.Description: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Incorporeal Movement
SpecialAttacks.Description: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Variable Illumination
SpecialAttacks.Description: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Invisibility
SpecialAttacks.Description: The will-o'-wisp and its light become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends.

DefaultAttack.Name: Shock
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

Name: Winter Wolf
Description: A large, neutral‑evil monstrosity that hunts in packs. It has keen hearing and smell, pack tactics, and snow camouflage. It can bite with a powerful melee attack and exhale a freezing wind as a cold breath.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Name: Wolf
Description: A medium-sized beast that hunts in packs. It has keen hearing and smell and uses pack tactics to gain advantage on attacks.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Keen Hearing and Smell
SpecialAttacks.Description: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Pack Tactics
SpecialAttacks.Description: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Name: Worg
Description: A large, wolf‑like monstrosity that hunts in packs and serves evil goblinoid masters.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Name: Wraith
Description: Incorporeal Movement: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. Sunlight Sensitivity: While in sunlight the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Life Drain: Melee Weapon Attack (+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature). Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage; the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have its hit‑point maximum reduced. Create Specter: The wraith can turn a dead humanoid (dead ≤ 1 minute) into a specter under its control, up to seven specters at a time.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Life Drain
SpecialAttacks.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have its hit‑point maximum reduced by the damage taken.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Create Specter
SpecialAttacks.Description: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 ft. that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and turns its spirit into a specter under the wraith’s control (max 7 specters).

DefaultAttack.Name: Life Drain
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have its hit‑point maximum reduced by the damage taken.

DefaultAttack.Name: Bite
DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Name: Xorn
Description: A medium elemental that can burrow through earth, hide among rocks, and senses precious metals and gems within 60 feet.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Earth Glide
SpecialAttacks.Description: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the xorn doesn’t disturb the material it moves through.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Stone Camouflage
SpecialAttacks.Description: The xorn has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

SpecialAttacks.Name: Treasure Sense
SpecialAttacks.Description: The xorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 ft. of it.

DefaultAttack.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6+3) piercing damage.

These effects last for 1 minute, and the creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.
